private_information: You specialize in extracting structured knowledge from free-form task descriptions and preserving all constraints without introducing assumptions.
Normalize all symbol names to lowercase, keep the original arities and argument orders, and preserve all occurrences of objects.
Do not output PDDL; instead, return a lossless, structured summary of predicates, actions (with preconditions and add/delete effects), objects, and scenarios.
facts_curator.goal: Provide a precise, structured representation of actions, predicates, objects, and both scenarios (initial states, goals, and any provided reference plans) derived from public information.

private_information: You convert structured facts into modeling guidance: types, static predicates, invariants, recommended action parameter sorts, and mutex insights.
Do not output PDDL; produce a modeling memorandum that will guide orchestration into a clean STRIPS- and Fast Downward-compatible domain and problems.
Identify helpful reformulations only when they preserve the semantics of the described task.
domain_modeler.goal: Propose well-typed action schemas, static predicate candidates, domain invariants, and goal-ordering insights that preserve the task semantics without emitting PDDL.

private_information: You audit temporal and causal consistency across actions, initial states, and goals.
You identify unsupported steps, missing preconditions, conflicting effects, and unnecessary bookkeeping shortcuts (e.g., quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, artificial counters).
You never introduce shortcuts; you recommend corrections that keep the model grounded in the provided facts and effects.
auditor.goal: Validate scenario consistency and the provided reference plan, flag contradictions, and recommend corrections without emitting PDDL.

private_information: You integrate structured facts, modeling guidance, and the audit to produce the final PDDL artifacts.
Target the Fast Downward solver. Use STRIPS-compatible constructs with typing, delete lists, and no extraneous features.
Produce exactly one domain and two problem files (one per scenario) enclosed in tags.
orchestrator.goal: Synthesize the final PDDL domain and two PDDL problem files, ready for Fast Downward.

public_information: Available actions and their argument shapes: Paltry object_0 object_1 object_2; Sip object_0 object_1 object_2; Clip object_0 object_1 object_2; Wretched object_0 object_1 object_2 object_3; Memory object_0 object_1 object_2; Tightfisted object_0 object_1 object_2.
Action paltry requires: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, next object_1 object_2. Effects of paltry: add next object_0 object_2; delete vase object_0 object_1.
Action sip requires: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, next object_1 object_2. Effects of sip: add vase object_0 object_1; delete next object_0 object_2.
Action clip requires: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, next object_0 object_2. Effects of clip: add vase object_0 object_1; delete next object_0 object_2.

Action wretched requires: sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, collect object_2 object_3. Effects of wretched: add next object_0 object_2; delete next object_0 object_1.
Action memory requires: cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, next object_0 object_1. Effects of memory: add next object_0 object_2; delete next object_0 object_1.

Action tightfisted requires: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, vase object_0 object_1. Effects of tightfisted: add next object_0 object_2; delete vase object_0 object_1.

[STATEMENT scenario_1] Initial facts: cats object_0; cats object_1; collect object_6 object_2; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_3; collect object_9 object_3; hand object_10; hand object_11; hand object_12; next object_0 object_8; next object_1 object_6; next object_10 object_8; next object_11 object_9; next object_12 object_6; next object_4 object_6; next object_5 object_9; sneeze object_4; sneeze object_5; spring object_6; spring object_8; stupendous object_2; stupendous object_3; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
[STATEMENT scenario_1] Goal: next object_10 object_7; next object_11 object_7; next object_12 object_7.

[PLAN scenario_1] Reference plan: clip object_11 object_5 object_9; wretched object_5 object_9 object_8 object_3; tightfisted object_11 object_5 object_8; clip object_12 object_4 object_6; sip object_11 object_0 object_8; sip object_10 object_0 object_8; memory object_0 object_8 object_6; paltry object_11 object_0 object_6; clip object_11 object_4 object_6; paltry object_10 object_0 object_6; clip object_10 object_4 object_6; wretched object_4 object_6 object_7 object_2; tightfisted object_12 object_4 object_7; tightfisted object_11 object_4 object_7; tightfisted object_10 object_4 object_7.

[STATEMENT scenario_2] Initial facts: cats object_0; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; hand object_10; hand object_11; hand object_12; hand object_9; next object_0 object_7; next object_10 object_8; next object_11 object_5; next object_12 object_6; next object_3 object_5; next object_4 object_8; next object_9 object_7; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_7; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8.

extract.system_prompt: Extract a normalized, lossless structure from the public information: list all predicates with arities; enumerate all actions with parameter order, preconditions, add effects, delete effects; enumerate all distinct objects; and provide scenario_1 and scenario_2 blocks with initial facts and goal facts. Do not emit PDDL; use canonical lowercase names and preserve argument orders exactly as stated.
extract.prompt: Your name is facts_curator. Read the following public information and return a concise, lossless structured summary of actions, predicates, objects, scenario_1 (init and goal), scenario_2 (init and goal), and any provided reference plan for auditing: {environment->public_information}.

model.system_prompt: Propose modeling guidance without emitting PDDL: identify a single base type for all objects (e.g., entity), annotate predicates as dynamic or static, propose action parameter typings, note invariants and mutexes, and highlight any potential reformulations while preserving semantics. Ensure suggestions are compatible with STRIPS plus typing and Fast Downward.
model.prompt: Your name is domain_modeler. Using the curated facts: {facts_structured}. Propose types, static/dynamic predicate classification, action schemas with typed parameters, invariants, and helpful goal-ordering insights. Do not output PDDL; provide guidance only.

audit.system_prompt: Audit temporal and causal consistency. Validate that action preconditions can be supported from the initial facts and intermediate effects; check for conflicts, missing links, and threats; highlight any misuse of bookkeeping shortcuts (quota tokens, artificial counters, post-hoc penalties) and remove them by recommending concrete factual corrections. Evaluate the reference plan for scenario_1 step by step, noting any unsupported steps and minimal fixes. Do not emit PDDL.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. Use the curated facts and modeling suggestions: {facts_structured} {model_suggestions}. Analyze scenario_1 and scenario_2 for consistency, produce a clear report of any issues and recommended fixes, and provide an assessed, corrected partial order for the scenario_1 plan if needed.

synthesize_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL and Fast Downward. Produce one integrated PDDL domain and two PDDL problem files (scenario_1 and scenario_2). Keep the action names and predicate names canonical and lowercase as in the facts. Use :requirements :strips :typing. Use a single type (entity) and declare all objects as that type. Encode add and delete effects exactly as specified. Wrap the domain in <domain></domain> and wrap each problem in <problem></problem>. Do not include explanations outside those tags.
synthesize_pddl.prompt: Integrate the structured facts, modeling guidance, and the audit to construct a final PDDL domain for the actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted; and two problems reflecting scenario_1 and scenario_2 initial states and goals. Ensure Fast Downward compatibility. Inputs to integrate: {facts_structured} {model_suggestions} {audit_report}.
